label: Text preference
comment: The comment value is not used by Plex, and is only for your reference.
comment2: In fact you can add any key that you want for notes, etc.

label: Hidden text preference (passwords, etc.)
comment: These will be shown as dots/asterisks in the UI
comment2: Note that they can likely still be transmitted with http requests.
comment3: Plex is supposed to block transmission over http if 'secure' is 'true', but it does not always.

label: Boolean preference
comment: Values will be encoded to True or False python objects.

label: Enum preference
comment: These will be shown as drop down lists in the interface.

label: Text preference
comment: The hidden key is undocumented by Plex. It applies to every 'type' of preference.
comment2: This is unconfirmed, but it may hide the preference from interface.
